discussion.author: CohenCyril
discussion.comment: Dear @anton-trunov the failure in #351 was legitimate, and we do not use travis anymore (but gitlab-ci synced with coqbot), so you might as well remove `.travis.yml` altogether.

discussion.author: anton-trunov
discussion.comment:
> Dear @anton-trunov the failure in #351 was legitimate

Dear @CohenCyril, I agree that the last one was legitimate due to finmap relying on `sumbool` type for `eqVneq`, I meant some failures before that.

> we do not use travis anymore (but gitlab-ci synced with coqbot), so you might as well remove .travis.yml altogether.

I wasn't aware of that, will remove it.

discussion.author: anton-trunov
discussion.comment: Yesterday I got a bunch of emails from Travis, saying that the build was failing for Coq 8.6. It would feel nice not to get those :)

discussion.author: CohenCyril
discussion.comment:
> Yesterday I got a bunch of emails from Travis, saying that the build was failing for Coq 8.6. It would feel nice not to get those :)

I think it is your personal travis running. I agree let's get rid of it.

tags.description: Issue or PR about the CI. (Gitlab CI or CI of dependencies problems linked with math-comp)

commits.author: anton-trunov
commits.message:
Remove support for Travis CI

Mathcomp switched to Gitlab CI via coqbot, see here:
https://github.com/math-comp/math-comp/pull/353#issuecomment-497017174
